Name: patrickvacek
AboutMe:
Software engineer, musician, mathematician, acoustician, cryptographer, traveler, vegan cook, German enthusiast, cyclist, etc.

I've written C/C++ for years, but I've also used several other languages in the past (QBASIC, VB.NET, ASP.NET, HTML, MSSQL, MySQL, C#, Java, even some Lisp and Prolog), and these days I also use Fortran and Matlab.

After growing up on Windows, I started using GNU/Linux around 2009 and made the switch for home computing in 2012. I haven't looked back. In fact, I broke my Windows drive in the process of switching and I've never even bothered to try to fix it. I use Linux Mint, but also have experience with Ubuntu and CentOS/RHEL.

My solo music (The Nowhere Man) can be found here, my best collaborative work (Missing Values) can be heard here, and my music reviews/criticism can be found here.
